alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 3:24AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Randolph County through 400 AM CST... At 324 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Morrison Cross Roads, or 7 miles north of Wedowee, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Woodland, Morrison Cross Roads, Graham and Newell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for east central Alabama.
